IRS990.MissionDesc: MATER DEI SCHOOL PROVIDES EDUCATION FOR BOYS IN GRADES 1 - 8.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES TO BOYS IN GRADES 1 - 8.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NET EARNINGS ON THE PRINCIPAL RESTRICTED GIFT OF THE ENDOWED PANTALEO FUND ARE TO BE AVAILABLE FOR THE FUNDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE SCHOOL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. HOWEVER, INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE SCHOOL'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS SUBJECTED TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE SCHOOL REPRESENTS THAT THERE IS NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, AND ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REQUIRED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE MANAGEMENT OF THE SCHOOL DID NOT IDENTIFY ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE SCHOOL'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES FOR A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS. WHILE NO INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE CURRENTLY BEING EXAMINED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, TAX YEARS SINCE 2020 REMAIN OPEN.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 50,684. FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH TUITION REVENUE ON AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS -563,050. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 43,157.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 50,684. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 43,157.
FINANCIAL AID NETTED WITH TUITION REVENUE ON AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS 563,050.
ADVERTISEMENTS ARE MADE IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS ON A REGULAR BASIS.

THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BASED UPON A PROCEDURALLY OBJECTIVE PROCESS. IT IS ABLE TO DOCUMENT AND MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS AS THEY ARE EXPENDED WITHIN AND FOR THE SCHOOL'S EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
BONUSES ARE PAID TO ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL. THE AMOUNTS ARE INCLUDED IN PART II, COLUMN B (II).
THE NUMBER IN COLUMN(B) OF PART I REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHRISTOPHER ABELL, TRUSTEE, IS THE FATHER-IN-LAW OF WILLIAM BEDNARZ, DEAN OF FACULTY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THIS RETURN IS PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS OF THE SCHOOL MUST SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED AND THE MEMBER IS RECUSED FROM VOTING IF A CONFLICT ARISES. ANY POTENTIAL TRANSACTIONS OR RELATIONSHIPS ARE REVIEWED AND DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO PARENTS AND BOARD MEMBERS UPON REQUEST.
